tuv.seg: Getting married is a serious commitment
Gealltanas tábhachtach atá sa phósadh
Marriage is a legally binding contract that will affect both parties (and, to a certain extent, their children) for all of their lives
Conradh dleathúil atá ann a mbeidh tionchar aige ar an dá pháirtí (agus, go teoranta ar a gclann) ar feadh a saoil agus fiú i ndiaidh a mbáis
There are a number of strict rules and regulations governing marriage
Tá roinnt rialacha daingne a bhaineann le pósadh
The first set of rules specifies who may and may not marry each other and in what circumstances
Baineann an chéad chuid le cé hiad na daoine gur féidir agus nach féidir leo pósadh agus cé na cúinsí a bhaineann leis sin
Once you have fulfilled these conditions and are sure that you are entitled to marry, you should consider how you wish to marry
Nuair atá na coinníollacha seo sásta agat ba cheart an cinneadh a dhéanamh cén chaoi gur mhaith leat pósadh
There are several different ways (religious, secular and civil) of solemnising a marriage so that it is legally binding
Tá roinnt bealaí eagsúla ann le pósadh (searmanas cráifeach, saolta agus sibhialta) sa chaoi go mbeidh sé dleathúil
Please note that this section deals only with the legal requirements for the capacity to marry
Baineann an píosa seo leis na rialacha dleathúla amháin a bhaineann le pósadh
If you are marrying through a religious or secular ceremony, you should discuss their requirements with the celebrant of your marriage
Má tá tú le pósadh ag searmanas cráifeach nósaolta ba cheart a gcuid coinníollacha a phlé le céiliúraí an phósta
To contract a legally valid marriage in Ireland the parties to the marriage must:
Le pósadh dleathúil a chur i gcrích in Éirinn ní mór do na páirtithe:
• Have the capacity to marry each other
• a bheith in ann a chéile a phósadh
• Freely consent to the marriage
• pósadh dhá ndeoin féin

Free consent may be absent if, at the time of the marriage, a person is suffering from intoxication, brain damage, mental disability, mental instability or insanity to the extent that he/she is not able to understand the implications of marriage

D'fhéadfadh sé nach mbeadh an pósadh curtha i gcrích dá d(h)eoin féin má tá duine ar meisce, duine ag fulaingt damáiste intinne, míchumas intinne, neamhshéasmhacht intinne nó gealtachta agus nach dtuigeann sé/sí na himpleachtaí a bhaineann leis an bpósadh
Additionally, if someone agrees to marry because of threats or intimidation, his/her apparent consent may also be invalid and the marriage may be void
Sa bhreis ar sin, má aontaíonn duine pósadh de bharr bagartha nó imeaglaithe, d'fhéadfadh sé go mbeadh a t(h)oil samhalta neamhbhailí agus mar sin nach mbeadh aon phósadh ann
• Observe the necessary formalities
• cloí leis na rialacha cuí
To be legally entitled to marry, both of you must fulfil all of the following requirements at the time the marriage takes place
Le bheith i dteideal chun pósadh go dlíthiúil, ní mór dá tú a chomhlíonadh gach ceann de na ceanglais seo a leanas ag an am a thógann an pósadh ar siúl
• Be over 18 years of age or have a Court Exemption Order if this is not the case
• Bheith os cionn 18 mbliana d’aois nó Ordú Díolúine Chúirte a bheith agat murab amhlaidh an cás
• Have given the Registrar 3 months' notification of the marriage (or have a Court Exemption Order if this is not the case) and have been issued by the Registrar with a Marriage Registration Form

• Fógra i leith an phósta trí mhí a bheith tugtha maidir leis an bpósadh (nó Ordú Díolúine Chúirte a bheith agat murab amhlaidh an cás) agus Foirm Chlárúcháin Phósta a bheith eisithe duit ag an gCláraitheoir
A couple whose civil partnership was registered in Ireland do not have to give the 3 months' notice
Níl ar lánúin a raibh a bpáirtnéireacht shibhialta cláraithe in Éirinn an fógra 3 mhí a thabhairt

• Be either single, widowed, divorced, a former civil partner of a civil partnership that ended through death or dissolution, or have had a civil annulment of a marriage or civil partnership or a valid foreign divorce or dissolution

• Bheith singil, ina mbaintreach/baintreach fir, colscartha, nó ina n-iar-pháirtnéirí sibhialta i bpáirtnéireacht shibhialta ar cuireadh deireadh léi trí bhás nó scaoileadh, nó neamhniú sibhialta a bheith déanta ar bhur bpósadh nó páirtnéireacht shibhialta nó colscaradh nó scaoileadh bailí iasachta a bheith faighte agaibh
(If you are marrying your civil partner you do not need to have your civil partnership dissolved before marrying
(Má tá do pháirtnéir á phósadh agaibh, ní gá go ndéanfar bhur bpáirtéirneacht shibhialta á scaoileadh sula bpósfar sibh
It will be automatically dissolved when you marry.)
Scaoilfear í go huathoibríoch nuair a phósfar sibh.)
• Have the mental capacity to understand the nature of marriage
• An cumas meabhrach a bheith agaibh cineál an phósta a thuiscint
• Not be related by blood or marriage to a degree that prohibits you in law from marrying each other
• Gan gaol fola nó pósta a bheith eadraibh a dhlúithe sin a chuireann toirmeasc oraibh sa dlí óna chéile a phósadh
If you are related to your proposed spouse by blood or by marriage, you should contact a solicitor to ensure that you do not fall within the prohibited degree of relationship
Má tá tú gaol fola nó pósta agat le do chéile beartaithe, ba cheart duit teagmháil a dhéanamh le haturnae lena chinntiú nach dtagann tú faoi chuimsiú na teorann toirmiscthe caidrimh
(See "Further information" below on prohibited degrees
(Féach “Breis faisnéise” thíos maidir le teorainneacha toirmiscthe
If either party doesn't fulfil even one of the above requirements, any subsequent marriage ceremony is legally void
Mura gcomhlíonann ceachtar páirtí fiú ceann amháin de na ceanglais thuas, beidh aon searmanas pósta a dtabharfar faoi ina dhiaidh sin ar neamhní go dlíthiúil
Note: Since 16 November 2015 the requirement to be of opposite sex does not apply
Nóta: Ón 16 Samhain 2015, ní bhaineann an ceanglas go mbeidh lánúineacha den ghnéas eile
If you are ordinarily resident in the State, the minimum age at which you may marry is 18 years (unless you have a Court Exemption Order)
Má tá gnáthchónaí ort i Stát na hÉireann, is í an aois íosta ag ar féidir leat pósadh 18 mbliana d’aois (mura bhfuil Ordú Díolúine Chúirte agat)
This is the case even if you marry outside of Ireland
Is ionann an cás fiú má phósann tú lasmuigh d’Éirinn
Even if you are not ordinarily resident in the State, you must be over 18 years of age if you wish to marry someone in Ireland
Fiú mura bhfuil gnáthchónaí ort i Stát na hÉireann, ní mór duit bheith os cionn 18 mbliana d’aois más mian leat duine a phósadh in Éirinn
There is no requirement for parental consent to a marriage, irrespective of the ages of the parties concerned
Níl aon riachtanas ann chun toiliú tuismitheora a fháil i leith pósta, is cuma cén aois iad na páirtithe lena mbaineann
Exemption from age requirement
Díolúine ón riachtanas aoise
In certain special circumstances, you may be able to get a Court Exemption Order allowing the marriage to proceed even if one or both parties are under 18
Faoi chúinsí speisialta áirithe, d’fhéadfá bheith in ann Ordú Díolúine Chúirte a fháil a ligfidh don phósadh leanúint ar aghaidh fiú má tá páirtí amháin nó an bheirt pháirtithe faoi bhun 18
The court will require you to show:
Iarrfaidh an chúirt ort an méid a leanas a léiriú:
• That there are good reasons for your application
• Gurb ann do thréanchúiseanna le d’iarratas
• That the granting of such an Exemption Order is in the best interests of the parties to the intended marriage
• Go bhfuil deonú an Ordaithe Díolúine sin chun leasa is fearr na bpáirtithe don phósadh a bheartaítear
You should contact either the Circuit Family Court or the High Court for details on how to proceed
Ba cheart duit teagmháil a dhéanamh leis an gCúirt Teaghlaigh Chuarda nó an Ard-Chúirt chun teacht ar shonraí faoi conas leanúint ar aghaidh
This is an informal procedure
Nós imeachta neamhfhoirmiúil atá i gceist leis seo
You may apply in person (without hiring a solicitor)
Féadfaidh tú iarratas a dhéanamh tú féin (gan aturnae a fhruiliú)
There is no court charge for an application for a Court Exemption Order
Ní bheidh aon táille chúirte ann le haghaidh iarratais ar Ordú Díolúine Chúirte
However, if you hire a solicitor to represent you, you will have to pay him/her
Má dhéanann tú aturnae a fhruiliú le hionadaíocht a dhéanamh duit, beidh ort íoc as/aisti, áfach
Not all foreign divorces are recognised under Irish law
Ní aithnítear gach colscaradh iasachta faoi dhlí na hÉireann

Under the Domicile and Recognition of Foreign Divorces Act 1986, a foreign divorce will only be recognised in Ireland if at least one spouse was domiciled in the state that granted the divorce when the proceedings started

Faoin Shainchónaí agus Aithint Colscarthaí Coigríche 1986, ní aithneofar colscaradh iasachta in Éirinn ach amháin má bhí sainchónaí ar a laghad céile amháin sa stat a dheonaigh an colscaradh nuair a cuireadh tús leis na himeachtaí
You may have to provide good evidence that this was the case and, therefore, that the divorce is valid under Irish law
B'fhéidir go mbeidh ort fianaise a chur ar fáil lena chruthú gurb amhlaidh a bhí an cás agus, ar an ábhar sin, go bhfuil an colscaradh bailí faoi dhlí na hÉireann
Under EU Regulation 2201/2003 (“the Brussels II bis”) it is the spouse’s habitual residence that determines a court’s right to grant a divorce
Faoi Rialachán AE 2201/2003 ("na bis na Bruiséile II"), tá sé gnáthchónaí an chéile go gcinnfidh an ceart cúirte colscaradh a dheonú

Where the divorce comes within EU regulations, it is sufficient to confirm that both parties to the divorce were notified of the proceedings and had an opportunity to give evidence to the court which granted the divorce

Nuair a thagann colscaradh faoi chuimsiú rialacháin an AE, is leor a dheimhniú gur cuireadh an bheirt pháirtithe don cholscaradh ar an eolas faoi na himeachtaí agus go raibh deis acu chun fianaise a thabhairt don chúirt a dheonaigh an colscaradh
Where EU regulations do not apply, certain information as to place of birth, countries of residence and other relevant facts must be supplied on a questionnaire provided by the Registrar
Sa chás nár bhain rialacháin AE, ní mór faisnéis áirithe faoi áit bhreithe, tíortha cónaithe agus fíricí ábhartha eile a chur ar fáil ar cheistneoir a chuireann an Cláraitheoir ar fáil
The information is then forwarded to the General Register Office, whose consent is required before the marriage ceremony can take place
Cuirtear an fhaisnéis ar aghaidh ansin chuig an bPríomh-Oifig Chárúcháin, nach mór a dtoiliú a fháil sular féidir le searmanas an phósta leanúint ar aghaidh
If the General Registrar is of the opinion that the foreign divorce is valid, then the new marriage can go ahead
Má bhíonn an Cláraitheoir Ginearálta faoin tuairim gur bailí don cholscaradh iasachta, féadfaidh an pósadh nua leanúint ar aghaidh
If not, you can provide additional information to prove validity or else you can apply for a hearing before the Circuit Court

Murab amhlaidh tuairim an Chláraitheora Ghinearálta, féadfaidh tú tuilleadh faisnéise a chur ar fáil chun bailíocht a chruthú nó féadfaidh tú iarratas a dhéanamh ar éisteacht os comhair na Cúirte Cuarda
The Court's decision on the validity of a foreign divorce in Irish law is final and binding, although you may, of course, appeal to a higher court
Cinneadh deiridh atá ina cheangal atá i gcinneadh na Cúirte maidir le bailíocht cholscaradh iasachta i ndlí na hÉireann, ach féadfaidh tú, dar ndóigh, achomharc a dhéanamh do chúirt níos airde
If the Court decides that your foreign divorce is not binding, your only option if you wish to remarry in Ireland may be to get a divorce under Irish law
Má dhéanann an Chúirt an cinneadh nach bhfuil do cholscaradh iasachta ina cheangal, is é an t-aon rogha atá agat, más mian leat pósadh arís in Éirinn, colscaradh a fháil faoi dlí na hÉireann

If a legal dissolution of a civil partnership is granted outside Ireland, it will be recognised under Irish law if the Minister of Justice and Equality has made an order recognising the appropriate class of legal relationship in the country in which the dissolution was granted

Má cheadaítear scaoileadh dlíthiúil páirtnéireachta sibhialta lasmuigh d’Éirinn, aithneofar é faoi dhlí na hÉireann, má rinne an tAire Dlí agus Cirt ordú a aithníonn an aicme chuí den chaidreamh dlíthiúil sa tír inar ceadaíodh an scaoileadh
Prohibitions apply to marriage between certain people related by blood or marriage
Baineann toirmisc le pósadh idir daoine áirithe a bhfuil gaol fola nó pósta eatarthu
A couple who fall within the prohibited degrees of relationship cannot marry
Ní féidir le lánúin a thagann faoi chuimsiú na dteorainneacha toirmiscthe caidrimh pósadh
These prohibitions are based on:
Tá na toirmisc seo bunaithe ar an méid a leanas:
• Consanguinity – blood relationship including half blood (half blood means having one parent in common, for example a half-brother)
• Gaol fola – caidreamh fola, caidreamh leathghaol fola (ciallaíonn ‘leathghaol fola’ go mbíonn tuismitheoir amháin i gcoiteann, mar shampla, leathdheartháir)
• Affinity – relationship by marriage
• Gaol cleamhnais – caidreamh trí phósadh
The prohibited degrees apply to a wide range of family relationships and include marital and non-marital offspring
Baineann an teorainn thoirmiscthe le réimse fairsing de chaidreamh teaghlaigh agus áirítear léi sliocht pósta agus neamhphósta araon
An adopted child is within the prohibited degrees in relation to its natural family and adoptive parents
Tá leanbh uchtaithe laistigh de na teorainneacha toirmiscthe maidir lena dteaghlach nádúrtha agus a dtuismitheoirí uchtaíocha
However, it would appear an adopted child can marry the child of their adoptive parents
Ba dhealraitheach, áfach, gur féidir le leanbh uchtaithe leanbh a dtuismitheoirí uchtaíocha a phósadh
You can marry your deceased spouse's sister or brother
Féadfaidh tú deirfiúr nó deartháir do chéile éagtha a phósadh
This also applies if your marriage ends due to a divorce rather than a death
Is amhlaidh a bhíonn i gceist, chomh maith, má chuireann colscaradh, seachas bás, deireadh le do phósadh
There is no legal restriction on the marriage of first cousins
Níl aon chosc dlíthiúil ann ar phósadh col ceathracha
